Settings are stored in settings. But there is not much to alter.  For testing purposes one should make use of the commandline.  Stop savvy? : killall savvy Start savvy : /usr/local/bin/savvy.sh  Savvy is best started from within the reccmds.conf  Configuration ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ mpeg2decFolder=../mpeg2dec-0.4.0 # Set this according to your folder containing the (compiled) libmpeg  Tip: It's important to decompress savvy in parallel to mpeg2dec-0.4.0, otherwise compile is to be adjusted  ./compile chmod 777 compile  Now, savvy should compile without errors  + case STATE_BUFFER: - case -1:  In src/video.c line 602 has to be altered  zcat savvy.0.12b.diff.gz | patch -p1 cd savvy.<VERSION> tar -xvzf savvy-<VERSION>.tgz cd $SOURCEDIR  The patch can be found here.  To compile savvy with libmpeg2 version 0.4.0 (mpeg2dec-0.4.0) the sources have to be patched.  make install make ./configure --prefix=/usr/local cd normalize-<VERSION> tar -jxvf normalize-<VERSION>.tar.bz2 cd $SOURCEDIR  and normalise  make install make ./configure --prefix=/usr/local cd mpeg2dec-<VERSION> tar -xvzf mpeg2dec-<VERSION>.tar.gz cd $SOURCEDIR
